data.message: When you follow your dreams stay persistent and give it all you got, then even against all odds you can reach them. Eminem a poor white kid from the ghetto against all odds entered a predominantly black profession, and became one of the best rap artists in history. And the best lyricist to ever do it his lyrics and word play are unmatched. Then he battled addiction and overcame it. One of the hardest things to do. Something 90% of addicts can't do. He inspires me and shows me there is no reason no excuse any one can't become successful at what they do and persever in life. He went from this run down little home in the ghetto driving a junker to all he has now. As a recovering addict my self clean 4 years I went from living in Camden city NJ like Detroit homeless at times to sucsessfull at what I do one of the best a beautiful family beautiful home in a uperclass neighborhood and a will to keep pushing forward.

replies.message: Im inspired dawg. keep it up
https://m.facebook.com/MayorMikeDuggan/ fuck this man go bash him

Very well said bro as streams of tears roll down my 47 year old eyes I realize my dreams, our dreams, our encompassed, intertwined, into this heavenly realm we call earth. I feel the same way. That initial hope is still there all these years later

Eminem will always be relevant. Possibly twenty five years ago I was excited and paid close attention to every detail, every word said, in an interview that has been dubbed possibly the most significant interview in history. Person doing the interview was Dan Rather. Person interviewed Marshall Mathers!
KevShadygrinding4lifetiltheypayme
I'm a recovering addict from NJ too! 4 years also. Keep it up!
keep it up man. this is inspiring, you're doing good for yourself
